description: Context processing configuration examples for different scenarios
usage: These configurations control how the RequestContext is processed and optimized for different endpoints

default_config.description: Standard configuration for most AI generation endpoints

character_focused_config.description: Configuration for character-specific endpoints like character-feedback

chapter_generation_config.description: Configuration optimized for chapter generation with full context

editor_review_config.description: Configuration for editor review focusing on recent content and feedback

memory_constrained_config.description: Configuration for environments with limited context windows

high_quality_config.description: Configuration for maximum quality with generous context limits

field_descriptions.summarization_enabled: Whether to summarize long content sections to fit within context limits
field_descriptions.max_context_length: Maximum number of tokens to include in the processed context
field_descriptions.priority_filtering: Whether to filter content based on priority levels (high, medium, low)
field_descriptions.character_focus: Array of character names to emphasize in context processing
field_descriptions.preserve_recent_content: Whether to prioritize recent chapters and feedback over older content
field_descriptions.include_feedback_history: Whether to include character and rater feedback in the context
field_descriptions.focus_on_current_chapter: Whether to emphasize the current chapter being worked on

optimization_levels.none: No optimization applied, include all available context
optimization_levels.light: Minimal optimization, remove only low-priority elements
optimization_levels.aggressive: Heavy optimization, keep only high-priority content

usage_recommendations.generate-chapter: Use chapter_generation_config or high_quality_config for best results
usage_recommendations.character-feedback: Use character_focused_config with specific character in character_focus
